location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.172 of 1856 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to a truce in the hostilities between the Persian Government and the Imam of Muscat. Jones writes that reports have reached him that the two sides have reached an agreement, in which Muscat forces were to take possession of Bunder Abbas [Bandar-e ʻAbbās] from Persia.
